entry.title: Armenian businesses rally to support Karabakh refugees: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenian businesses rally to support Karabakh refugees: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
Armeniaโs business community is rallying to support the tens of thousands of people displaced by Azerbaijanโs assault on Nagorno-Karabakh last week.
In less than a week, more than 90,000 people โ the majority of Nagorno-Karabakhโs population โ have fled their homes and arrived in Armenia. Most of them are arriving with only whatever belongings they could wear on their backs or fit in a car. Almost all of them are malnutritioned after nearly ten months living under Azerbaijanโs blockade.

entry.title: โWe waited to get out of the blockade, not from our homelandโ

media:group.media:title: โWe waited to get out of the blockade, not from our homelandโ
media:group.media:description:
Tens of thousands of people fleeing Nagorno-Karabakh continue to arrive in Goris, Armenia after a treacherous journey through the Lachin Corridor. Following a nearly ten-month blockade that left the region in famine, those who made it to Armenia say they were waiting for the opening of the corridor, but now they have lost both home and homeland. Azerbaijanโs attack last week on the region was the final push that led the population to the brink of ethnic cleansing.

entry.title: Nagorno-Karabakh Republic to be dissolved as Armenians flee en masse

media:group.media:title: Nagorno-Karabakh Republic to be dissolved as Armenians flee en masse
media:group.media:description:
๐The Nagorno-Karabakh Republic will be formally dissolved by the end of the year. ๐Over 70,000 people from Nagorno-Karabakh have fled to Armenia, according to the latest figures. ๐Azerbaijan brought criminal charges against Ruben Vardanyan that could land Nagorno-Karabakhโs former state minister in prison for decades. ๐Armeniaโs parliament may ratify the Rome Statute as soon as next week, paving the way for the country to join the International Criminal Court.

entry.title: Shattering the Silence on the West's Failure in Karabakh

media:group.media:title: Shattering the Silence on the West's Failure in Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian discusses Azerbaijan's ethnic cleansing of Nagorno-Karabakh Armenians and the international community's failure to stop human rights abuses.
He analyzes the root causes and geopolitical dimensions of the conflict, paying tribute to fallen soldiers and civilians.
Eric also outlines a vision for Armenia's path forward, advocating for reforms and support for the displaced people.

media:group.media:title: ีีฅีฆ ีดีซีกีพีธึีธึีด ีง ีดีฅีฏ ีญีถีคีซึ` ีี-ีซีถ ึีกีฒีกึีกีตีซีถ ีซีทีญีกีถีธึีฉีตีธึีถีซึ ีฐีฅีผีธึ ีบีกีฐีฅีฌีจ. ีีกีฏีธีข ิฟีกึีกีบีฅีฟีตีกีถ
media:group.media:description:
ิธีถีคีคีซีดีกีคีซึ ีธึีชีฅึีซีถ ีดีซีกีพีธึีธึีด ีง ีกีผีถีพีกีฆีถ ีดีฅีฏ ีญีถีคีซึ` ยซีีกีฒีกึีกึีซีกีฏีกีถ ีบีกีตีดีกีถีกีฃีซึยป ีฏีธึีฝีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีกีถีจ ึีกีฒีกึีกีตีซีถ ีซีทีญีกีถีธึีฉีตีธึีถีซึ ีฐีฅีผีธึ ีบีกีฐีฅีฌีจ ึ ีถึีก ีบีกึีฟีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถ ีกึีฑีกีถีกีฃึีฅีฌีจ, ีถีทีธึีด ีง ึีกีฒีกึีกีบีฅีฟีซ ีฉีฅีฏีถีกีฎีธึ ีีกีตีฏ ีีกึีธึีฉีตีกีถีซ ีถีฅึีฏีกีตีกึีธึึีซีน ีีกีฏีธีข ิฟีกึีกีบีฅีฟีตีกีถีจ ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ิฑึีทีกีฌีธึีตีฝ ีีฒีคีฅีฝีตีกีถีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฆึีธึีตึีธึีด: ิฟีกึีกีบีฅีฟีตีกีถีจ ีถีฅึีฏีกีตีกึีถีธึีด ีง ีจีถีคีคีซีดีกีคีซึ ยซีีกีตึ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถยป ีคีกีทีซีถึีซ ึ ยซีีกีถึีกีตีซีถ ีฑีกีตีถยป ีฏีธึีฝีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฏีธีกีฌีซึีซีก ีนีฏีกีฆีดีฅีฌีธึ, ีขีกีตึ ีถึีกีถึ ีฏีธีฒีดีซึ ีีกึีธึีฉีตีกีถีซีถ ึีกีฒีกึีกีบีฅีฟ ีจีถีฟึีฅีฌีธึ ีกีผีกีปีกึีฏีซ ีฟึีกีดีกีขีกีถีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ:

entry.title: Fleeing for their lives, Armenians from Karabakh share stories of war and displacement

media:group.media:title: Fleeing for their lives, Armenians from Karabakh share stories of war and displacement
media:group.media:description:
During the last few days, the forcibly displaced Armenians from Nagorno-Karabakh (Artsakh) have been arriving in Syunik where they are registered and directed to the allocated shelters. People who have lost their homes say that they could not bring anything with them, they got a hold of whatever fuel they could and fled. The people of Artsakh are concerned about how to re-establish themselves in different parts of Armenia. They speak to CivilNet about their most urgent anxieties for the future.
